name: Mince Pies
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden raisins'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried currants'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped candied orange peel'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lemon, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground mace'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) package', 'name': 'refrigerated dough for a double-crust pie, defrosted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}
steps: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Combine apples, brown sugar, raisins, golden raisins, currants, orange peel, lemon zest, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, allspice, mace, and ginger in a medium saucepan. Mix together and bring to a boil over medium heat.. Immediately turn the heat down to the lowest setting on your stovetop. Simmer, stirring frequently to ensure the mixture does not stick to the bottom of the pan, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Remove from the heat and leave to cool while you prepare your pastry.. Unroll pie crusts onto a flat surface. Cut into 24 circles using a cookie cutter or the bottom of a mug.. Place a circle into the bottom of each cup of a 12-cup cupcake tin. Fill each of the pastry circles with fruit filling.. Brush the edges of the pastry with some of the beaten egg and cover with the remaining circles. Brush all of the mince pies with more beaten egg.. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 35 to 45 minutes.

name: Old-Time Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'round steak, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried currants'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) jar', 'name': 'sour cherry preserves'}, {'quantity': '1 ⅓', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chopped candied mixed fruit peel'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'pitted sour cherries, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.1 ounce) package', 'name': 'double-crust pie pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar, for sprinkling'}
steps: Combine steak and cider in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook until steak is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove steak to a cutting board; coarsely chop, then return to the pot.. Stir in apples, currants, raisins, cherry preserves, 1 1/3 cups sugar, mixed fruit peel, and butter. Add ginger, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt. Simmer, uncovered, over low heat until mixture is very thick, about 1 hour 30 minutes. Stir in cherries and remove from heat.. Transfer filling to a container and allow to cool at room temperature. Cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 week before using.. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Line a 9-inch pie dish with 1 pastry crust. Spoon filling into crust and cover with second pastry crust. Crimp edges and cut several slits into top pastry. Brush with cream and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon sugar.. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 45 minutes.

name: Green Tomato Mincemeat
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'quarts', 'name': 'green tomatoes, minced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'quarts', 'name': 'minced, cored apples'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'beef suet'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '32', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'candied mixed citrus peel (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange, peeled, sectioned, and cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemons, finely chopped'}
steps: In a very large stock pot, combine green tomatoes, apples, suet (or oil), brown sugar, vinegar, chopped oranges, chopped lemons, raisins, and candied peel. Season with salt, cinnamon, cloves and allspice. Cover, and cook over low heat for 3 hours.. Sterilize 30 (1 pint) canning jars and lids according to manufacturer's instructions.. Ladle filling into the sterilized jars, leaving 1/2 inch head space. Wipe the jar with a clean, damp cloth. Cover with jars with lids, and screw on jar rings.. Heat water in a hot water canner. Place jars in rack, and slowly lower jars into canner. The water should cover the jars completely, and should be hot but not boiling. Bring water to a boil, and process for 10 minutes.

name: What Is Mincemeat Pie — and Does Mincemeat Pie Have Meat?
Classic Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.1 ounce) package', 'name': 'double-crust pie pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(29 ounce) jar', 'name': 'Crosse & Blackwell® Mincemeat Filling & Topping or Crosse & Blackwell® Rum & Brandy Mincemeat Filling & Topping'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. Unroll pie crusts. Line an ungreased 9-inch pie plate with one pastry. Fill with mincemeat filling. Cover with the second pasty and press the edges to seal. Cut slits in the top pasty to vent steam.. Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Meatless Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(18 ounce) jar', 'name': 'prepared mincemeat pie filling'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rum'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '2', 'name': '(9 inch) pie crusts'}
steps: Combine mincemeat, walnuts, apples, brown sugar, rum, and lemon juice in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate overnight.. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Adjust a rack to the lowest position.. Let filling come to room temperature. Meanwhile, prepare pie crusts. Line a 9-inch pie plate with one pie crust.. Stir mincemeat filling well, then pour into the prepared pie plate. Top with second pie crust and make slits or a lattice top. Crimp edges.. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 40 minutes.

name: Mincemeat Pie Filling
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped apples'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced cooked beef'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange - peeled, sectioned, and cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sorghum or molasses'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sweet pickle juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pineapple juice or apricot juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Mix apples, diced beef, raisins, sugar, beef broth, orange sections, sorghum, pickle juice, pineapple juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined.. Store filling in the refrigerator or freeze until ready to use.

name: Apple Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'prepared mincemeat (such as None Such®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped walnuts (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'package of refrigerated pastry for double-crust pie (such as Pillsbury®'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).. Place apples, butter, and lemon juice into a saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring often, until apples are tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Mix in mincemeat and walnuts until thoroughly combined and set the pie filling aside.. Fit pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish; pour filling into crust. With a brush dipped in water, moisten the edge of the bottom crust. Top pie with the second crust and crimp the two crusts together with a fork to seal. Cut 4 slits into top crust for steam vents. Whisk egg yolk with water in a small bowl and brush the yolk mixture over top crust.. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove pie from the oven and cover the crust edges with strips of aluminum foil to prevent overbaking. Return pie to the oven and bake until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling, 30 to 35 more minutes.

name: Traditional Mince Pies
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar, divided"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice water'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'prepared mincemeat pie filling'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}

name: Green Tomato Mock Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped green tomato'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled and chopped tart green apples'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped raisins'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pastry for a 9-inch double-crust pie'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, apples, brown sugar, raisins, vinegar, butter, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, and cloves together in a large saucepan; cook and stir over medium-low heat until bubbling and slightly reduced in volume, about 25 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and cool slightly, about 15 minutes.. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Press 1 pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish.. Pour green tomato filling into the pie crust; top with the second pie crust, crimping the edges together to seal.. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Decrease oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and continue baking until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Homemade Mince Pie with Crumbly Topping
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold butter'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped grapefruit peel without white layer'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'graham cracker, crushed'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'graham cracker, crushed'}
steps: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. In a bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of cold butter with 1 1/2 cups flour and the salt with a fork until the mixture is very crumbly. Mix in water, a tablespoon at a time, just until the mixture holds together. Mix again with a fork, then turn out onto a floured pastry cloth. Pat the dough out into a round piece, and roll out into a 10-inch circle. Invert a 9-inch pie dish onto the dough. Flip the dough over, and peel from the pastry cloth; adjust the crust into the plate if necessary. Fold the dough over the edge of the pie dish. Set the crust aside.. Combine the raisins, apples, grapefruit peel, orange juice, and apple cider in a saucepan, and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the apple pieces are soft, about 15 minutes. Stir in 3/4 cup of sugar, the cinnamon, cloves, and half a crushed graham cracker, and mix well.. Mix together 1/3 cup of sugar, 3/4 cup of flour, 6 tablespoons of butter, and half a crushed graham cracker in a bowl, stirring until the mixture looks like fine crumbs. Pour the mince filling into the prepared pie crust, and sprinkle evenly with the streusel topping.. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, and reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C); bake until the topping is lightly browned, about 30 more minutes. Allow to cool before serving.

name: Mock Mincemeat Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'seedless raisins'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'orange zest'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'soda crackers, finely crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie'}
steps: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. Stir the raisins, apples, orange zest, orange juice, and apple cider together in a pan. Simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until apples are very soft, about 20 minutes. Stir in the sugar, cinnamon, cloves, and soda crackers until well blended. Refrigerate until ready to use, or pour apple mixture into the prepared pie crust. Top with the second crust. Pinch and crimp edges to seal the crusts. Pierce the top crust in several places with a fork.. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until top is golden brown, about 30 minutes more. Cool before serving.

name: Christmas Mince Pies
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, cubed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable shortening, cubed'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'oranges, zested'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh orange juice, chilled'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'prepared mincemeat filling, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}
steps: Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Add butter and shortening; rub in with cold fingers until mixture resembles fine bread crumbs. Mix in sugar and orange zest thoroughly. Mix in vanilla extract. Stir in enough orange juice to bring dough together.. Knead dough briefly to form a smooth ball. Wrap in plastic wrap; refrigerate until firm, at least 1 hour.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Roll dough out on a lightly floured work surface to a thickness of 1/8 inch. Cut out 12 circles using a 2 1/2-inch cutter and 12 circles using a 1-inch cutter.. Line 12 mini tart pans or a muffin tin with the 2 1/2-inch dough circles. Cover dough with about 1 tablespoon mincemeat filling. Lay 1-inch circles on top.. Bake in the preheated oven until tops are pale golden brown, 17 to 21 minutes. Cool slightly on wire racks, about 10 minutes. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

name: Mum's Mincemeat
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'suet'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'sultana raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dark raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dried currants'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'candied mixed fruit peel'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chopped almonds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples, grated'}
steps: Melt suet in a saucepan over medium-low heat; strain liquid through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl and discard solids. Refrigerate liquid until again solid.. Grate solid suet, measure 12 ounces of grated suet into a bowl, and set aside.. Stir brown sugar, sultana raisins, dark raisins, currants, fruit peel, almonds, allspice, nutmeg, and salt together in a large bowl; add grated suet and stir. Fold grated apple through the mixture.. Cover bowl loosely with aluminum foil and allow it to sit at room temperature, stirring once daily, until fermented, 3 to 5 days. Refrigerate until needed.
